comment.body:
For most, there's really no reason. ZeroNet isn't fleshed out enough for normies to use IMO. 

The social sites are seriously lacking, and I'm not sure ZeroNet is a good place for them in their current iteration. 

Static documentation / persistent long term data seems like a good fit. 

I'm still thinking up something worth updating and sharing.
I definitely think ZeroNet, or something that follows it's ideas will indeed be the future of the connected web.
